page.title: 06INDUSTRY IN FENISCOWLES (2)
page.content: Star Paper Mill started in 1875 and now employs about 650 people. They make their paper from trees. The trees are cut up into smaller pieces and brought to the mill. The wood is then dissolved until it looks like porridge. Then it is drained for a long time on large sieves. Next it is pressed to get out more of the water and finally it is dried in huge driers. Next the sheets are coated with clay amongst other things and it finishes up as high quality glossy paper. Star Paper Mill is the only place in the country that makes such good glossy paper. It is exported to places all over the World including Australia, South Africa, Russia and America.
